page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: The age of the houses built by the council is 30-40 years. Most houses are semi-detached with some terraced, maisonettes and bungalows . Most are built of brick with tiled roofs and casement windows.The average number of people living in a house is 5. Most have at least one TV, and many have videos, computers and Hi-Fi. Most children go to Pilgrims Hatch and Hedley walter school.All homes have a garden. Most people shop in Brentwood at large supermarkets. There are small old peoples' housing estates. Peoples' opinion of Pilgrims Hatch transport service is that it is satisfactory. It's a quiet place,close to the town and close to the countryside but could do with more leisure facilities.
